artist: Marwa Arsanios, Raven Chacon, Bethany Collins, Tamar Guimarães, Kapwani Kiwanga, Hương Ngô, Aliza Nisenbaum, Alison O'Daniel, Toyin Ojih Odutola, Elle Pérez, Charlotte Prodger
showDescription: Nine Lives takes shape around a diverse set of protagonists, as if this exhibition were a collection of short stories or personal essays told from different points of view.
showTeaser: Nine Lives takes shape around a diverse set of protagonists, as if this exhibition were a collection of short stories or personal essays told from different points of view.
title: NINE LIVES

artist: Adolf Wölfi, Bill Traylor, Thornton Dial, Ken Grimes, Jim Bloom, James Castle, George Widener, and others...
showDescription: Throughout the years, Keen has developed an expansive, growing collection of exemplary works of outsider art that spans the breadth of the genre.
showTeaser: Throughout the years, Keen has developed an expansive, growing collection of exemplary works of outsider art that spans the breadth of the genre.
title: Outsider Art: The Collection of Victor F. Keen

showDescription: Corbett vs. Dempsey is pleased to unveil Objects From Elsewhere, an exhibition of recent sculptures by Richard Wetzel.
showTeaser: Corbett vs. Dempsey is pleased to unveil Objects From Elsewhere, an exhibition of recent sculptures by Richard Wetzel.
title: RICHARD WETZEL: OBJECTS FROM ELSEWHERE

showDescription: McArthur Binion’s painting series DNA:Work is an index of time, labor and identity, repurposing the Minimalist grid to examine a deeply personal narrative. Using the scale of his own body, Binion builds compositions from vivid, geometric patterns demarcated by an oil-stick grid.
showTeaser: McArthur Binion’s painting series DNA:Work is an index of time, labor and identity, repurposing the Minimalist grid to examine a deeply personal narrative. Using the scale of his own body, Binion builds compositions from vivid, geometric patterns demarcated by an oil-stick grid.
title: McARTHUR BINION: DNA-WORK AND THE UNDER:CONSCIOUS DRAWINGS

showDescription: Pairing a stunning new body of work with select historical pieces, the exhibition creates an unflinching examination of the American condition before and during the Trump presidency.
showTeaser: Pairing a stunning new body of work with select historical pieces, the exhibition creates an unflinching examination of the American condition before and during the Trump presidency.
title: DEBORAH KASS: PAINTINGS AND SCULPTURES

showDescription: Doug Stapleton is a master collagist. His works employ extreme precision, keen composition, and idiosyncratic source materials which address identity, history, and ancestral themes.
showTeaser: Doug Stapleton is a master collagist. His works employ extreme precision, keen composition, and idiosyncratic source materials which address identity, history, and ancestral themes.
title: Doug Stapleton: Dropped From the Clouds

showDescription: Sitting With My Thoughts” is about self-reflection and reflection on the world around us. Myron views this body of work as being in a meditative state. He incorporates figures, organic shapes and floral backgrounds, resulting in one harmonious piece.
showTeaser: Sitting With My Thoughts” is about self-reflection and reflection on the world around us. Myron views this body of work as being in a meditative state. He incorporates figures, organic shapes and floral backgrounds, resulting in one harmonious piece.
title: Myron Laban: Sitting With My Thoughts

showDescription: Elliot Bergman presents a large-scale installation of sculpture, works on paper, and sound objects. This immersive exhibition explores vibration, movement, light, and form.
showTeaser: Elliot Bergman presents a large-scale installation of sculpture, works on paper, and sound objects. This immersive exhibition explores vibration, movement, light, and form.
title: Elliot Bergman: Resonant Body

showDescription: Butler’s quilts present an expansive view of history through their engagement with themes such as family, community, migration, the promise of youth, and artistic and intellectual legacies.
showTeaser: Butler’s quilts present an expansive view of history through their engagement with themes such as family, community, migration, the promise of youth, and artistic and intellectual legacies.
title: Bisa Butler: Portraits
